page_analysis.text_content:
Determining setbacks on oddly shaped lots considerations

Fig 17 Setbacks for oddly shaped lots

Key
_____ Curb
- - - Lot line
[hatched pattern] Sidewalk
[outlined box] Required setbacks
[gray box] Buildable area

A
Flag lot
Rear yard
Front lot line is closest and most parallel to street.
Front yard
Rear yard
Front setback is 10' instead of 20'
Street

B
Corner lot
Rear yard
16'
Front yard
Street

C
Substandard Corner lot w/ frontage < 50'
Rear yard
10'
Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages.
Front yard
Street side setback is 10' instead of 16'
Street

D
Through lot
Rear yard
Front yard
Street

E
Wedge shaped lot
Wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines. The rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines.
Front yard
Street

F
Lot with more than 4 sides
Rear yard
Interior side yard
Front yard
Street

G
Lot with more than 4 sides
Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street.
Rear yard
Front yard
Street

23

visual_elements.description: Seven different lot configurations (A through G) showing setback requirements for oddly shaped lots. Each diagram shows the lot outline, required setbacks (outlined boxes), buildable areas (gray shaded), front yards, rear yards, side yards, and street positions. Includes a key showing symbols for curb, lot line, sidewalk, required setbacks, and buildable area.
visual_elements.location: Center of page, arranged in two rows

technical_specifications.parameter: Street side setback for substandard corner lot
Wedge shaped lot rear yard radius

structural_elements.main_heading: Determining setbacks on oddly shaped lots considerations
subheadings: Fig 17 Setbacks for oddly shaped lots

additional_notes: Page number 23 appears at bottom right
Diagrams use hatching pattern for sidewalks and gray shading for buildable areas
All measurements appear to be in feet based on context

qualifiers.text: Front lot line is closest and most parallel to street
Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages
Wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines
Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street

conditions.text: Street side setback is 10' instead of 16'
Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages
The rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines

logical_relationships.expression: If frontage < 50' then Street side setback is 10' instead of 16'

execution_sequence.action: Determine if lot is flag lot and identify front lot line closest and most parallel to street
For corner lots, check if frontage is less than 50 feet
Apply reduced setbacks for substandard corner lots
For wedge shaped lots, determine rear yard using radius method
For lots with more than 4 sides, identify rear lot line farthest and most parallel to street
